channel.title: Subtracting From an Int
channel.description:
Take this line for example: [code=java] text.println("\t\t<x>" + x + - 2 + "</x>"); [/code]
I want to display an X location for an NPC spawn dump command, and I want this X location to subtract 2 away from my player's current X coordinate so it displays the range for the NPC to walk.
This displays quite literally "<x>3924 - 2</x>" but I want it to display 3922 or whatever my X coordinate subtract 2 is at the time. How would I do this?
I've also tried + x - 2 + but that gives me an error.

item.title: Subtracting From an Int
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

I think i understand what you’re trying do to…

You have the +'s in the wrong spot

I think that’s what it needs to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Subtracting From an Int
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:1, topic:421939”]Take this line for example:

text.println("\t\t<x>" + x + - 2 + "</x>");

I want to display an X location for an NPC spawn dump command, and I want this X location to subtract 2 away from my player’s current X coordinate so it displays the range for the NPC to walk.

This displays quite literally “3924 - 2” but I want it to display 3922 or whatever my X coordinate subtract 2 is at the time. How would I do this?

I’ve also tried + x - 2 + but that gives me an error.[/quote]
to show x-2[the answer]
put
text.println("\t\t" + (x - 2) + “”);

Read full topic
